enhanced_by.reason: The text() method sets the text content of the TextNode, which is necessary for splitText to operate on the correct text.
The getWholeText() method retrieves the full text content, which is used by splitText to determine the split point.
The isBlank() method checks if the text node is blank, which can be used to assert the state of the text node after splitting.
The text() method retrieves the normalized text content, which can be used to assert the correctness of the split operation.
